Superconducting Reactor

A faded description in the bottom right corner reads: The SUPERCONDUCTING REACTOR utilizes the centripedal force generated by a rapidly rotating plutonium core in order to recycle its expelled neutrons back towards the core itself, allowing for a much higher reaction yield in a much smaller time than with previous designs. The tungsten rotating shell transfers the nuclear energy into kinetic energy that generates an electromagnetic field inside of a motor encased by supercooled, superconducting metallic hydrogen compounds.

Brainwave Mapping Spectacles

The BRAINWAVE MAPPING SPECTACLES utilize piezoelectric silicon sensors and actuators combined with highly attuned enriched magnesium and gallium flux receptors to capture and record changes in magnetic flux, electromagnetic field, skin temperature, skin moisture content, air and skin salinity, and mecahnical vibration of the specimen wearing the device. The gathered information is processed by the DUTRA-MIND algorithm and is translated from raw input data into comprehensible language and imagery.

Mobile Satisfaction Injector

The MOBILE SATISFACTION INJECTOR features an array of reloadable magazines that carry concentrated ingredients from each of the protein, carbohydrate, and lipid families of organic macromolecules. These raw ingredients are sent via sterile teflon tubing to a mixing hub driven by a platinum-caesium catalyst. The mixed compounds are then ejected from the barrel of the device and allowed to react with the atmosphere to cool and solidify into their chosen final form, usually donuts. Why? Because donuts.
